add.title: add(value)
add.desc: Adds the value to the variable. Strings that can be converted to integers will be summed, not concatenated, as in the example below.

args.name: value
args.desc: The value to add to the variable before printing it to the page. Accepts any array, object, number, and string.

addslashes.title: addslashes
addslashes.desc: Returns a string with backslashes in front of characters that need to be quoted for database queries, etc.

capitalize.title: capitalize
capitalize.desc: Capitalize the first character in the string.

date.title: date(format[, tzOffset])
date.desc: Convert a valid date into a format as specified. Mostly conforms to php.net's date formatting.

args.name: format
args.desc: The format to convert the date to. See the date formatting table for formatting options.

args.name: tzOffset
args.desc: The timezone offset in minutes from GMT to display the date in.

default.title: default(value)
default.desc: If the variable is undefined, null, or false, a default return value can be specified.

args.name: value
args.desc: Fallback value if the variable is falsy.

escape.title: escape([type])
escape.desc: Force escape the output of the variable. Optionally use e as a shortcut filter name. This filter will be applied by default if autoescape is turned on.

args.name: type
args.type: If you pass the string <samp>js</samp> in as the type, output will be escaped so that it is safe for JavaScript execution.
